meanings.definition: Aphagias: plural form of aphagia, the inability to swallow
meanings.sent1: After his stroke, the patient developed aphagias, making it hard for him to eat.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the child with aphagias after noticing her difficulty in swallowing.
meanings.sent3: The party game involved pretending to have aphagias and trying to eat without swallowing.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of public speaking felt like an aphagias, choking her words before they could be spoken.
meanings.sent5: The image of the blocked road sign represented the aphagias, a barrier to progress.

meanings.definition: Aphagias: third person singular present of aphagia, to be unable to swallow
meanings.sent1: He aphagias when he is nervous, finding it hard to swallow his words.
meanings.sent2: The baby often aphagias when given solid food, preferring milk instead.
meanings.sent3: The robot aphagias on command, refusing to consume any data.
meanings.sent4: Her anxiety aphagias her ability to speak up in meetings, leaving her silent.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave seemed to aphagias any sound, swallowing it whole.
